title: 114_hr1707
content: The "Access to Frontline Health Care Act of 2015" establishes the Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program under Subpart XIII of the Public Health Service Act. This program aims to provide loan repayment for frontline health care providers. The Secretary will establish the Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program, where individuals agree to serve as health professionals for at least 2 years in a frontline care scarcity area in exchange for student loan repayments. To be eligible, individuals must submit an application and sign a contract with the Secretary. The Loan Repayment Program requires individuals to submit an application and sign a contract with the Secretary for approval. Preference is given to applicants with interdisciplinary training. The Secretary determines scarcity areas for contract placements. The Secretary gives preference to areas with interdisciplinary health care programs or plans. Written notice is provided upon approval for participation in the Loan Repayment Program. The contract includes an agreement for student loan repayment. The Loan Repayment Program allows individuals to receive student loan repayment in exchange for providing frontline care services for a minimum of 2 years at a health care facility in a scarcity area. The contract includes financial obligations for both the United States and the individual. The Loan Repayment Program requires individuals to fulfill a 2-year service obligation at a healthcare facility in a scarcity area in exchange for student loan repayment. The contract outlines financial obligations for both the United States and the individual, including the determination of annual repayment amounts by the Secretary to attract healthcare providers to the program. The program allows the Secretary to make payments directly to an individual's loan provider for student loan repayment. If an individual breaches the contract by not fulfilling their service obligation, the United States can recover the total amount paid under the contract plus interest. Definitions include the term 'frontline care scarcity area'. The term 'frontline care scarcity area' refers to an area, population group, or facility designated as a health professional shortage area or by the State as lacking frontline care services in various healthcare fields. The loan repayment program for healthcare professionals includes a variety of eligible providers such as general surgeons, optometrists, physical therapists, pharmacists, and more. The implementation of this program must begin within 180 days of enactment.
